alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 12:43PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow Expected Sunday Morning through Tuesday Afternoon... A front moving into the Interior will stall just north of Fairbanks Sunday morning and will continue in place into Tuesday afternoon. Snow is expected to develop Sunday morning and will continue into Tuesday afternoon with the heaviest snowfall expected to fall in the higher terrain north of Fairbanks. Storm total snowfall of 4 to 7 inches is expected in the higher terrain north of Fairbanks with 3 to 5 inches expected in the Fairbanks area through Tuesday afternoon. 2 to 4 inches is expected in the North Pole area with 1 to 2 inches expected in the Delta Junction, Nenana, Healy and Denali Park areas. There is a slight chance that freezing rain may mix with the snow at times along the Parks Highway south of Nenana on Sunday morning.
